content:
You're thinking like a pro! Suggesting a meetup point and time is a great idea, as it will help ensure everyone knows where and when to gather. This will also give you a chance to do a quick safety check, make any last-minute adjustments, and get everyone on the same page before you start riding.

Here's a suggestion:

* Suggest a specific meetup point, such as a parking lot, trailhead, or coffee shop, that's easily accessible and has ample parking.
* Choose a meetup time that gives everyone enough time to arrive, get ready, and do a quick safety check before you start riding. You might consider a 30-minute window to account for any unexpected delays.
* Consider suggesting a specific meeting spot at the trailhead, such as a landmark or a specific sign, to make it easier for everyone to find each other.

Example:

"Hey everyone, let's meet at the parking lot near the trailhead at 9:00 AM. We'll do a quick safety check, make any last-minute adjustments, and get started on our 10-15 mile ride around 9:30 AM. Don't forget to bring your safety gear, including helmets, and dress comfortably. Looking forward to seeing you all there!"

By suggesting a meetup point and time, you'll help ensure a smooth and organized start to your ride. Just remember to be flexible and accommodating, and be prepared for any last-minute changes or adjustments.

Now, go ahead and send out that group message, and get ready for a fun and safe ride with your friends!
